keyTakeAways: Ian Roberts, formerly of Des Moines Public Schools, is indicted by a federal grand jury for falsely claiming U.S. citizenship on an I-9 form, a violation of immigration law.
Roberts, originally from Guyana, was detained by ICE in September 2025 and was found in possession of firearms while unlawfully present in the U.S.
The indictment includes two counts: one for making a false statement on an employment eligibility form and one for possessing a firearm as an illegal alien.
A total of four firearms were found — two pistols, a rifle, and a shotgun — including one wrapped in a towel inside a district-issued vehicle.
An immigration judge previously issued a final removal order, and an appeal to reopen proceedings was denied earlier in 2025.
Des Moines Public Schools is now suing the consulting firm used during the 2023 superintendent search, alleging improper promotion of Roberts.
Jackie Norris, school board chair, initiated an investigation into Roberts' expenditures and ended her campaign for U.S. Senate on the same day as the indictment was filed.

summaryOfNewsArticle: Ian Roberts, the former superintendent of Des Moines Public Schools, has been indicted by a federal grand jury for falsely claiming U.S. citizenship on an I-9 form and for possessing firearms while an illegal alien. Originally from Guyana, Roberts was detained by ICE in September 2025, fled during an encounter, and was later found with a handgun in a district-issued vehicle. A search of his home uncovered three additional weapons, including two pistols, a rifle, and a shotgun. An immigration judge previously finalized a removal order, which was not appealed. The district has launched a lawsuit against the consulting firm that promoted Roberts during the 2023 hiring process, and school board chair Jackie Norris initiated an expenditure review, subsequently ending her campaign for U.S. Senate. This case raises serious concerns about immigration compliance, public employee eligibility, and ethical practices in school leadership hiring.
title: Iowa Superintendent Detained by ICE Falsely Claimed He Was a US Citizen, Indictment Says
